skill.name: meeting-insights-analyzer
skill.description: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, and actionable feedback. Identifies when you avoid conflict, use filler words, dominate conversations, or miss opportunities to listen. Perfect for professionals seeking to improve their communication and leadership skills.
skill.summary: Analyzes meeting transcripts and recordings to uncover behavioral patterns, communication insights, ...
skill.author: Joseph OBrien

security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based documentation skill. It contains NO executable code, NO network calls, NO external commands, and NO environment variable access. All 33 static findings are false positives: the scanner misidentified markdown code block delimiters (```) as shell backticks, GitHub URLs and JSON hash values as cryptographic threats, and common words like 'identify'/'discover' as reconnaissance terms. The skill only provides behavioral guidance for AI-powered meeting transcript analysis.

content.user_title: Analyze Meeting Transcripts for Communication Patterns
content.value_statement: Meeting transcripts contain valuable insights about your communication style that most people never discover. This skill identifies patterns in conflict avoidance, speaking habits, listening skills, and leadership behavior to help you become a more effective communicator.
actual_capabilities: Identifies conflict avoidance patterns with specific transcript examples
Calculates speaking ratios and turn-taking statistics
Detects filler words and hedging language usage
Evaluates active listening and question-asking behavior
Tracks communication trends across multiple meetings
limitations: Requires pre-transcribed meeting files in readable formats
Cannot access live meeting audio or video streams
Analysis quality depends on transcript accuracy and speaker labels

use_cases.title: Improve Meeting Facilitation
use_cases.description: Identify how inclusive your meetings are and discover ways to draw out quieter team members.

use_cases.title: Prepare for Performance Reviews
use_cases.description: Gather concrete examples of your communication strengths with timestamped evidence.

use_cases.title: Coach Direct Reports
use_cases.description: Help team members understand their communication patterns with specific feedback.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Conflict Check
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze all meetings in this folder and tell me when I avoided difficult conversations.

prompt_templates.title: Speaking Balance
prompt_templates.prompt: Look at my meetings from the past month and calculate my speaking ratio compared to others.

prompt_templates.title: Listening Assessment
prompt_templates.prompt: Analyze these transcripts and identify moments of active listening versus missed opportunities.

prompt_templates.title: Quarterly Comparison
prompt_templates.prompt: Compare my communication patterns between meetings from Q1 and Q2. Show trends.

output_examples.input: Analyze all my meetings and tell me when I avoided conflict.
output: Found 23 instances across 15 meetings of indirect communication or tension avoidance.
Pattern: Hedging on critical feedback (8 times across 7 meetings).
Example from 1:1 with Sarah at 00:14:32: 'So I was thinking... maybe we could potentially consider looking at the timeline again?'
Recommendation: Name issues directly and remove hedging words like 'maybe' and 'potentially'.

output_examples.input: Tell me about my facilitation style in team meetings.
output: You speak 60% of the time while team members speak 40%.
Your question-to-statement ratio is 1:3, indicating directive leadership.
You resolve disagreements quickly (avg 2 min) which may suppress team input.
You draw in quieter members 3 times per meeting on average.

best_practices: Use consistent file naming like 'YYYY-MM-DD - Meeting Name.txt' for easy organization.
Ask about one behavior at a time for deeper, more actionable insights.
Review patterns monthly or quarterly to track meaningful improvement over time.
anti_patterns: Analyzing meetings without speaker labels, which reduces pattern accuracy.
Asking for everything at once instead of focusing on specific improvement areas.
Ignoring improvement suggestions and not tracking progress on changed behaviors.

faq.question: What file formats does this skill support?
faq.answer: Works with .txt, .md, .vtt, .srt, and .docx transcript files that have speaker labels.

faq.question: How many meetings can I analyze at once?
faq.answer: No hard limit. Can process dozens of meetings though very large datasets take longer.

faq.question: Can I integrate this with transcription services?
faq.answer: Export transcripts from Granola, Zoom, Google Meet, Otter.ai, or Fireflies.ai to a local folder.

faq.question: Is my meeting data kept private?
faq.answer: Yes. All analysis happens locally on your machine. No data is sent to external servers.

faq.question: Why is my analysis missing patterns?
faq.answer: Ensure transcripts have clear speaker labels and timestamps. Low-quality transcripts reduce accuracy.

faq.question: How is this different from other meeting tools?
faq.answer: Provides deep behavioral analysis focused on personal communication patterns and growth.
